page.title: 08Wimbledon Common (1)
page.content: In 1871 the Wimbledon Common Act made the area a public open space, a wide expance of open, uncultivated land.This includes Putney Heath. At Tibbet's Corner Underpass a sign of a highwayman commemorates past scenes of robbing here.The Telegraph pub takes its name from an Admiralty Telegraph Station there in 1796 (during the Napoleonic Wars) for semaphore signalling between Portsmouth and Whitehall. Commander Peter Dean is Clerk and Ranger to the Putney and Wimbledon Common Conservators. This group of 8 rate-payers, who live near the Common, 5 of whom are elected every 3 years and 3 people appointed by the Government, are in charge of this unique Common. It is financed by a yearly rate levied on all householders living within a certain distance of the Common. Policy is decided at monthly meetings.(cont-)
